channel.title: World of Warcraft & Runescape Pros and Cons

item.title: World of Warcraft & Runescape Pros and Cons
item.dc:creator: @mr_arrows95 bansil
item.description:
@mr_arrows95 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:25, topic:334583”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=430983.msg3164711#msg3164711 date=1269906436]

Or… you could get a PS3 or 360 and get LIVE and play 110% better games online for 8$ a month instead of 1 shitty game for 15$.

PS3 LIVE = FREE;

& SHIT

I have had 6 xbox 360s all are a piece of shit.

What is the most opened thing in the world that isn’t a door? An xbox 360.

Microsoft makes more money fixing xbox 360s then selling them. Oh heres your argument: Yer but microsoft fixes them for FREE, you xbox 360 comes with a warranty.
Answer: A 1 year warranty.

Ps3 - Blue- ray, free online games, better graphics

Xbox 360 - Halo, Halo Reach. End of Discussion.

/Xbox 360
[/quote]
Too bad that the only people who think PS3’s are better are the people with them, and they use the same RROD excuse all the time. They wont admit that the xbox is better in every way, community, DLC, online play and connection, and graphics. Their graphics are practically the same but theres a reason the xbox’s is better. Most games are made for the XBox specifically (unless they’re by sony fags) and ported to pc and ps3, which makes them suck alot more.

Microsoft lost billions of dollars fixing them you idiot.[/quote]Frell just owned the fuck out of you

Read full topic

item.title: World of Warcraft & Runescape Pros and Cons
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:18, topic:334583”]When my uncle got it a while back, we were able to play it for the whole month? Was very stupid after the first 5 days. That or something happened, because after the month was up, we couldn’t login. Unless my uncle payed for it without telling me, for the month (its actually very possible with him -.-)[/quote]Dude lols, once your trial is up, you got to upgrade your account (requires buying a game card) and buy the actual CD, because the client you were using to login is called “trial client” Actual members’ can’t use it to log in, only players with trial acc’s. Once you upgrade, you need to install the actual WoW client which is to be honest if you don’t have all the cd’s is around 12gig, if you got all the cd’s (3 of them) then to be honest not much downloading… just installing, probably about 200mb of downloading, just from some recent patches.

item.description:
@Berky-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Mr Mopar, post:2, topic:334583”]World of warcraft:
Pros:
-Good graphics
-Alot of players
-Updated often
-Big map
-Trial(30 days)
Cons:
-Cost alot for membership
-Confusing at first
-You have to install a big ass file
-Trial is only 30 days

Runescape:
Pros:
-Free
-Big map
-Fun(for some people)
-Updated weekly
-Easy to start out
-Membership is $5.00
-Pretty good graphics
Cons:
-Bots
-Removed good updates
-People can be ass holes
-You can still get scammed
-Recovering accounts takes awhile
-Some of the rules are retarted
-Lags

Pretty much sums them out for me.[/quote]
I tought that WoW trial was 10 days?

WOW con:
You need a good pc, reqruirements.
You need like a very good game card or else the game will NOT run. I had a big problem with that untill I bought a new pc.

Read full topic
item.source: World of Warcraft & Runescape Pros and Cons

item.title: World of Warcraft & Runescape Pros and Cons
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

It is not $20 a month. It is $15.

It is not a 30-day trial. It is a 10-day trial.

WoW has so many players willing to download its ~14 GB worth of files because it’s a better game. (Opinion, maybe, but with 10 million more ACTIVE players (10M people WILLING to pay that $15/month), it takes major Rune-fanboys to think differently)

I recently got my girlfriend to play WoW. At first, 2 weeks earlier, we had tried playing RuneScape. She couldn’t figure out a single thing. RuneScape has NO way to show new players how to play when they first start. They have to randomly just run around and find how things work click-by-click. On WoW, I’m not going to lie, she still had trouble. She’s new; it happens. But, unlike RuneScape, WoW gives you tips AS you need to do things when you first start, telling you HOW to do what you’re trying to. In the same time we tried playing RuneScape, she learned probably 250% more in WoW.

Lester, in WoW you can fish. Google “WoW fishing”. That point’s finished.

I’m only really attacking a few people with this, obviously as a WoW fanboy. Posting cons, they should at least be right.

I played RuneScape for 4 years. I’ve played WoW for 2 1/2. I HIGHLY suggest, if you can pull the $15/month out of your ass, that you at least try WoW. Its game make-up is so much better than RuneScape, obviously another opinion, but oh well.

Read full topic

I played the trial for WoW, and yes, if i had the money, i would have easily gotten hooked. Found a copy of Lord Of The Rings still in its wrapper for $2, so i used that. Payed for it for about 2 months. got bored because of the pc requirements. I would have to keep it on a USB and play it on my uncles computer.

WoW Con:
High PC requirements…

item.source: World of Warcraft & Runescape Pros and Cons

item.title: World of Warcraft & Runescape Pros and Cons
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Biosoft Mr_Biosoft
item.description:
@Mr_Biosoft wrote:

As opposed to completely starting over allow me to continue from Mr Mopar’s post.

World of warcraft:
Pros:
-Decent graphics
-Alot of players
-Updated often
-Big map
-Trial(30 days)
Cons:
-Cost alot for membership ($15 a month approx)
-Confusing at first
-You have to install a big ass file (several big ass files)
-Trial is only 30 days
-Graphics Style (This is based on opinion, I dont like the way the graphics look)

Runescape:
Pros:
-Free
-Big map
-Fun(for some people)
-Updated weekly
-Easy to start out
-Membership is $5.65 (or something like that)
-Pretty good graphics
-Large Community

Cons:
-Bots
-Removed good updates
-People can be ass holes
-You can still get scammed
-Recovering accounts takes awhile
-Some of the rules are retarted
-Lags
-Deleted a lot of cool things such as randoms and what not.
-No more wildy PVP in all worlds (Old school pvp)
-You can randomly get banned just for Jagex thinking you broke a rule even f you didnt.

in all I didnt add to much to Mr Mopar’s… Ill update if I ca think of more.

Read full topic
